text: Birra 33cl. Molto profumata dal gusto gradevolissimo. Anche se preferisco le dolci belghe, è davvero una birra di ottima qualità, davvero ben fatta.
Clavo, platano, ligera vainilla y moscatel. En boca es sedosa y el final es seco y largo.

330ml bottle @ Chez Sophie. Pours deep hazy brown, small tan head. Aroma is vibrant weise yeast, creamy banana. Continues to the taste with a pillowy smooth mouthfeel, good creamy banana and dark fruits. Fairly rich, in a good way. Very enjoyable.

330ml bottle. Pours bit hazy brown colour. Nice medium white head. Slight sourness, slight notes of smoke, notes of banana in the aroma. Slight sweetness, bananas, sourness, hints of raisins, flowery notes in the tastes. Slight. sharpness in the end. Caramelly, flowery notes in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, medium carbonated, solid brew.

33cl bottle @Sr.Lúpulo, Gijón. 10-12-2016.
Shared with fombe89.
Reading other ratings i wonder is this is the beer we had.This was a smoked one.
Pours hazy copper with frothy off white head. Malty, smoky, raisins, ripe fruit nose. Taste follows the nose. Little smoked, not excesive.
0,6l Flasche. Mahagoni farbenes Bier mit einer schönen Schaumkrone. Fruchtiges Aroma, schmeckt nach gerösteten Malz und reifer Banane. Gut!

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Past its BBD.
Appearance - amber to brown with a decent head.
Nose - toffee and orange. Banana esters lurking. 
Taste - more banana and toffee with just a touch of orange on edge. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a fairly elegant finish. 
Overall - good example of the style.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2016 Buona birra perfettamente nello stile. Il profumo è tipico di dunkelweizen. Poco citrico, un po speziato e abbastanza maltoso. Il cappello di schiuma si dissolve un po troppo rapidamente ma in generale è molto scorrevole. Birra ben fatta.

Botella @Señor Lúpulo. Despacho de cervezas, Gijón 10/12/2016 
Color ambar, sabor cereal malta, notas ahumadas.

Bottle from Pix in the craft beer advent calendar. Pours a pretty murky brown colour with a thin cream head. Toasty wheat aroma. The taste has buttered toast with spice, a hint of clove and a touch of chocolate and banana. Ok.

Bottle, enjoyed one month before bbd. Pours cloudy brown, with an enormous creamy, off white head. Aroma is light yeasty, with wheaty notes, banana cake and chocolate. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is light yeast with a wheaty sting, and slightly burned malts with bread, chocolate and toffee. Nice, lingering bready sweetness, with high drinkability.

On tap at Le Saint-Bock. Cloudy reddish-brown with a small beige head, some retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is mostly of banana with mild spiciness, toasted malts, red berries and earthy/mineral notes. Taste is slightly acidic with bananas, toasted malts, moderate spiciness, earthy/mineral notes, red fruits/berries and mild bitterness. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Fruity and earthy finish. Pretty good Dunkelweizen. The light body and acidic notes makes the drinkability quite high but its also quite flavorful. Lacks body a bit.
50cl @ tap. Buon arome, colore ambrato (sempre se mi han servito la birra giusta ahahah). Si beve bene, come al solito birrificio italiano fa buone birre.

Esters, grain and cereal malts, wheat, light yeast, spices, generic fruits. Hazy brown, massive, off-white, creamy head. Light bitter. Light citrus fruits continue, more yeast and esters, grain malts, soft carbonation, medium bodied, cloves. Decent Dunkelweizen, good aroma, maybe a bit weak in the taste and palate. Keg at The Italian Job, Chiswick.

An Italian craft beer, coming in a pretty cool looking 75 cl bottle, with an over-sized cap. The label oozes class. Vudu spelt out in dramatic colouring and surrounded in stylish iconography. With a price rang between 11 to 13  this beer better be good!!

On pour, light brown colour, with a large tan head

Decent head, that maintains, very good lacing, looks good

Very strong smell, very strong but very appealing, can smell lots of flavours, lots of fruits from banana (and lemon), very sweet. Wheaty, toasty malts, very very earthy.

Great on the nose. A very rustic earthy smell with lots of fruits. very appealing..

First reaction from the taste is that this is a strong beer, very strong, can definitely feel the 6%. Has body and can get the taste all in the back end, the wheat and hops noted. Earthy.

 I liked this beer, not very sweet, but bitter, but not overbearing. Dark chocolate/caramel tastes, like a stout, but not quite. Roasted malts and fruit (Banana mostly), creamy undertones

Is a slow burner, definitely one to drink while relaxing in front of the box, or over a meal. In fact it was so full of delicious tastes and very filling that it was like a proper meal!

Loved it. Strongly recommended! Has character, style and taste, is rich in body, and one of the better beers I have had in a long time. Will definitely buy again, no matter the price tag of 11!..

Keg at the brewery restaurant. A clouded red brown coloured pour with a a sticky beige head. Aroma is tangy banana, bready malts, hint of infection, . Flavour is composed of sweet banana and toffee malts, little apple and smoke, tangy. Palate is semi sweet, rounded, moderate to low carbonation. Ok.

Probada en Ruzanuvol (Valencia) de tirador. Cerveza de color castaña con una espuma muy cremosa, persistente y de color beige que se va quedando pegada al vaso. Olor muy evidente a plátano. Sabores tostados, a frutas maduras y de nuevo a plátano... quizás demasiado persistente al principio, pero en general una cerveza muy agradable que se acaba sin darte cuenta.
Draft. A hazy dark brown beer with a lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of wheat, banana, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of wheat, caramel, and bananas, leading to a dry wheaty finish.
Kick 310316. Dark amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, berries. Flavour is berries, fruit, malt, citrus, caramel, wheat, spices. Medium body. OK beer.
On tap at Ruzanuvol, Valencia. Pours brown with beige head. Roasted malts, dried fruit, some banana, spices, yeast. Sweet. Medium bodied. Decent.

Degustata alla spina presso il Birrificio Italiano. Perfetta allaspetto con ottima schiuma pannosa persistente, marrone torbido. Forte profumo di banana e leggero di castagna. Difficile da decifrare facile da bere.
Mid brown colour with thin head. Aroma and flavour are fruity, sweet and quite floral.
Draft at The Ginger Man, NYC. Cloudy light brown with a white head. Mild aroma of dark malts. Taste is dark malts, caramel, dark fruits and toast. Ok.

Tap. Italian Job, Chiswick, London. Murky brown. Bubbly, lasting, sticky, cream coloured head. Nose has dates. Plums. Dried stone fruit. Ripe banana. Spicy hop. Taste is soft sweet. Some stone fruit dryness. Palate is full, smooth and foamy. Finishes a little dry, with a spicy sweet close.
Brun dimmig öl med beige skum. Doft och smak av pepprig jäst, karamell och lätta bananestrar.

Tap @ Kick. Slightly unclear dark amber body with a medium sized tan head. Aroma has malt, caramel, some berries and hint of banana. Flavor is mild malty, some caramel, slightly sour berries, and moderate in banana and wheat impression. Medium body and average aftertaste. Not particular exiting beer, but not bad and quite pleasant actually.

Draught @ Gastropuben KICK Malt & Mat, Kristiansand
Pours hazy dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, banana and wheat. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long banana, caramel and wheat finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Muddy Amber pour small soapy head. Nose is wheat and Carmel. Tastes of caramel, wheat, banana, dark bread, light herbal. Weird palate and weird brew. Not really traditional dunkel.

On tap at Kick. An unclear dark brown beer with a dense light beige head leaving curtains. Dried fruits, banana, caramel, some spiced hints and toffee in the aroma. Toffee, dried fruits, banana, spice hints and some berry hints in the flavor. Bitterness notes, lasting a good while. Rather boring this one. Sure drinkable though..160227

buona interpretazione dellos tile, con un bellodore di frutta rosso sotto spirito, nocciole, frutta disidratata, pane al burro e leggero sentore di banana. In bocca cè una buona dolcezza ed una discreta secchezza finale. Birra ok, tra le migliori del birrificio italiano.
On tapa at Cirkus, Stavanger. Pours hazy dark amber with a small head. Aroma of banana and light roasted wheat. Taste is moderate sweet, some unpleasant butterscotch, overshadowing any other taste.

Supert krankupp på Circus 25.1.16 sammen med Ovesen. Nøttebrun rav med cremeskum - igjen topp score på utseendet. Saftig bærsyrlighet, nesten syltetøyaktig. Litt kanel og karamell sniker seg inn etter hvert. Ekssemplarisk munnfølelse.

From tap at Cirkus with JMD 25.01.16. Cloudy chestnut. Persistent beige head and lacing. Aroma of caramel malt and dark syrup. Similar taste, with some strawberry jam. Balanced by moderate bitterness. Dark caramel malt and lingering on in aftertaste, still balanced by moderate bitterness.

Bevuta sia in bottiglia allo sfuso di torino che alla spina allopen baladin. Rende molto di più in bottiglia. Colore brunastro torbido. Schiuma abbondante e non troppo persistente. Al naso fruttato con speciali sentori di banana. Al gusto, nei lotti migliori la banana esplode. Non bevetala con delle olive salate alla montefiascone come me in questo momento perché non rende.

Draught. Pours a cloudy brown with a mostly lasting light beige soft bubbly head. Aroma of toffee, nuts, woody, dark fruits. Taste is of dark fruits, fig, toffee, clove, bubblegum, nutty. Slick, oily, soft carbonation.
Allolfato trovi sentori di banana, crosta di pane e pepe, il gusto è ricco e di buona persistenza, il corpo è pieno e le note di caramello scivolano via lentamente.

Couleur brune sombre, légère mousse blanche. Nez sucre roux un peu cuit, note caramel et levure. Gout malté, un peu toasté, caramel, sucré, levures avec notes légères épices et levures. Corps moyen. Fin assez sur la levures et caramel.

Bottle 75cl with nice shape kindly shared by Calisky. A cloudy brown beer with huge off white head, medium retention. Nose is on yeast with kind of smoked notes. Aroma is on sweet malt, caramel, brown bread, bit of biscuit, light banana notes, marzipan and spicy body. Good, unfortunately the yeast is not as expected kind of brown ale finish.
Fruchtiger Geruch; Banane, Traube. Süßer, fruchtig-malziger Auftakt. Mitte dunkles Malz, Schokolade, Frucht. Abgang bananig-hefig, schokoladig. Gut.

Draft @ Via Napoli Ristorante e Pizzeria in EPCOT. Pours cloudy medium brown color with tan head. Caramel and toasted malt aromas. Malty and nutty flavor with caramel and moderate sweetness. Medium body with average carbonation.
Für ein Dunkelweizen sehr speziell, dick und hocharomatisch im Rosinenbereich. Fruchtig, moderate Bitterkeit, etwas Milch und Kaffee. Gute Sache.

Spina @ Birrificio Italiano. Colore marrone torbido, con media schiuma beige poco persistente. Aroma di malto, debole nota di banana e cioccolato, ed anche luppolo. Sapore dolce, birra vellutata, molto beverina, ed interessante - sul finale - anche la nota di luppolo ben bilanciata. Carbonatazione media, corpo medio; sempre unottima scelta.

Sample from REWE Dortmund Craft Beer Day. The beer has got a hazy dark brown colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of roasted wheat and mild fruits. Taste of roasted wheat, light yeast, malt, mild fruits and straw. Enjoyable, yet nothing spectacular special.

Draught at Razanubol, Valencia. Cloudy dark red/brown - white head. 
Banana. Fruity. Dark bread. Light bitterness. Chocolate. Light fruity. Spicy notes. Tjaaa.

Oh oh this beer could make you want to drink dark weizen more often.. "be careful this could be addictive" the guy to poured this for me warned. A truely unique beer from - what? ITALY. Wow - we salute the brew master
Schöne dunkelbraune Farbe im Glas, stabiler Schaum. In der Nase herrlich malzig, m Trunk setzt sich das fort, schöne Süße, komplex aber doch rund. Süffig lecker.
Tap at Gar Eden. Dark weizen apparently and has a bit of the banana thing going on but more caramel. Light fruitiness too. Interesting and fairly easy drinking. Herbal at end. Bubblegum too. Nice.

Spina @ folkstudio.
Scura torbida con bella schiuma persistente.
Delicata e in perfetto stile come da copione per il birrificio.
Bravi!

33 cl in teku. Pours a beige medium head; colour is a cloudy murky/mahogaby hazy brown. Wrapping aroma, malty, wheaty, nuts, raisins, clove, esters, fruity plum banana, torta "paesana" (its a traditional chocolate and dried fruits italian cake); very nice indeed. Tastes caramel malty, dried fruits, clove cinammon /sweet spices, sultanas. Medium bodied, ok carbonation, nice creamy texture. Almost any bitterness, the sweet dominant note is really nice and balanced, keeps it very drinkable. The best italian dunkel weizen/ dark wheat beer

Bona cervesa, és bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.
Keg at the Hanging Bat. Sweet malty toffee, light bitterness, light caramel.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, fruits
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, abrupt finish
Overall-good balanced
UPDATED: SEP 14, 2015 On tap @ La Ratera (Milan).Dark amber and creamy. Aroma: banana and matlTaste: caramel, malt and fruits. Light hop at finish.

Bouteille 33cl @ Tempesta, Bologna.
Brune foncée-acajou, col blanc léger.
Arôme est fruité, ici aussi qcq esters, ponctué dun bouquet biscuité, malté avec un rappel à des Cracker Jack et note de pomme/poire caramélisée.
Palais est malté modéré, léger biscuité, pointe de sucre candi? levure en retrait, fruité noir entre date et raisin. Solide sur un léger petit sucre résiduel.
Br. Italiano démontre ici toute sa capacité à offrir de solide bières allemandes. Sans en changer le style, le résultat est solide.
Light banana and spice, a bit of bubblegum sweetness, hint of wheaty acidity, and a little bit of dark malt. Ok dunkelweizen.

Sample @Camba Tap House München, BKL 2014. Pours a nearly mauve brown with tiny head. Pillowy yeast profile, lightening up more traditional tastes of peach compote, maroni, caramel, figs and banana into a more digestible taste experience. Another fearless Italian style crossover - would never have classified this as a Dunkelweizen, could just as well have been a wheat-inflected, wine barrel aged Dubbel.

on tap at the camba taphouse in munich. murky purple brown with a lingering off-white head; pretty authentic dunkelweizen with some caramelised banana in the nose, hint of sea breeze, touch of burnt grass in the finish
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes braunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, röstmalzig, leicht fruchtig würzig. Geschmack hefig, leicht würzig, leicht fruchtig.
Pours a murky brown with a big beige head. Aroma of malts,sugar and banana. Taste is malt,sugar,banana,very thin bitterness.

Prodotto interessante, che unisce il gusto dei malti tostati alle note di banana e zucchero caramellato di una weizen in un matrimonio che da frutti molto saporiti, per un complesso decisamente piacevole.

A Vári Művekkel kóstolva.
 Vörösesbarna színe van, belül igen zavaros, habja pedig, na az meg hova lett? Illata olyan tuttifrutti cukorkás, aszalt gyümölcsös, édes dohányos, szilvalekváros. Ízében is van ebből a műanyag cukorkából, erdei bogyós gyümölcsökkel, élesztővel, túlérett citrusokkal és egy kis búzamalátával, fanyarsággal. Sűrű, de nem túl testes és apró buborékokkal van teli. Utóíze pipadohányos, édeskés, élesztős, kissé fanyar. Fura egy figura, az biztos!

(draught) pours a murky brownish ruby colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of hazelnuts, vanilla, lightly roasted wheat, banana skins and sugar icing. flavour is mostly caramel, brown sugar and toasted wheat, with a hint of floral hops and some alcohol in the semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

(tap) Es hat eine dunkelbraune Farbe, ist fast undurchsichtig, mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist hefig, mit braunem Zucker, Malz und gebuttertem Toastbrot. Der Geschmack ist hefig, schwer, mit Feige sonst wie das Aroma. Es ist nicht bitter und hat viel CO2.
Keg at The Hanging Bat. Decent dark wheat beer. Banana and clove aromas in evidence, dark brown pour with a good off-white head. Very creamy texture. Nice.

Bottle dark amber color with tan very short lasting head. Aroma is malts some fruits banana taste is malty with some hops aftertaste is slightly bitter with malts and fruits very nice dark Weizen in a beautiful bottle but is a little bit to expensive.

Probably dunkelweizen is one of the most underrated beer styles ever, but Vùdù can be a good starting point for a redefinition of the genre; this rich, parfumed but easy to drink dark wheat ale is surely the best example of the style in Italy. Interesting, well balanced, not too sweet.

11th September 2013Murky brown beer with a tidy pale cream coloured head. Palate is smooth and dry with a stinging minerally carbonated trailing edge. Smooth malt, semi sweet. Mellow spice, cinnamon. Nice mellow generic fruits and a sweetish bubblegum ester. Finishes slightly crisp. The palate holds this all together in to a nice beer.
[19-OCT-2013] Draught at EurHop Beer Festival (EBF) 2013 in Rome. Pours brown to orange with a beige head, aroma of honey, banana, malt, flavor of banana, malt, phenol, medium bodied

[10/19/13] Draught at Eurhop Beer Festival 2013 in Rome. Murky brown with a beige head. Aroma of yeast, malt, caramel, some fruity esters, a bit of spiciness and sourish notes. Sweet flavor with light tartness, malt, caramel, bubblegum, some fruity esters and light spicy notes. Medium-bodied. OK.

9oz goblet at Paradiso Dupont. Pours a inky amber with one ring of off white head. Nose is heavy on the prune and raisin, clove, banana bread, bubblegum. Flavor is the same, lots of candy sweetness, cotton candy, clove, orange, date. Sweet finish. Heavy.
På fat. Gedigna dofter av russin, apelsinkaka och lime. Smaken är det heller inget fel på: Torkad frukt, mörkt bröd, sirap och citrus. En mjuk beska hittas. Medelfyllig kropp.

Bottle at GBBF 2013. Cloudy dark brown, hints of clarity, off white head. Nose is estery ripe banana, clove, caramel, toffee, bready. Taste is rich bready, sweet, pungent, caramel, toffee, banana. Very rich and sweet. Yum!
Hazy chestnut with nice head. Aroma of sour cherries, sweetness, banana, and caramel. Taste of banana, caramel, brown sugar, dried fruit, nuts. Sweet finish

Bottle 75 cl from Maruhn - Darmstadt (D). Brown with average beige head sticking on the glass. Aromas of roasted malt, toffy, with banana and yeast. Idem to the taste, soft, smooth, creamy, with fruity notes of wheat, caramel, not too bulky. Perfect for the breakfast.

Dark brown hazy body with small beige head. Prunes, caramel, brown sugar, toffee. Soft carbonation. The aroma was better than the taste. Extra appearance score for the glassware design. At Il Santo Brevitore they serve almost every beer in original glassware. Shared with some new acquaintances I made there 18.05.13. They turned out to be beer lovers and Norwegian as well. Cheers Atle&Elin!

04/05/2013 Bir&Fud (tap). Ambrata carica, molto torbida, schiuma biancastra abbondante, non molto persistente. Al naso sentori metallici evidenti, banana, malto, caramello. In bocca meglio, dolce allattacco, frumento, caramello, melassa, finale appena amarognolo. Corpo medio, carbonazione media. Non perfetta, ma discretamente equilibrata.

on tap @ L Inganno. La perla del Birrificio Italiano.  Ha un intenso profumo di lievito, di banana matura e un bellacidulato dato dal Frumento. La schiuma è compattissima e molto stabile. La birra è scura, impenetrabile, color caffè con riflessi nocciola e mogano. Il gusto è deciso, di malto tostato, di caffè, di liquerizia e con qualche richiamo di acidulo.Prima del finale è addirittura dolce. il corpo è rotondo, la carbonatazione decisa il finale lungo avvolgente, quasi pastoso.

0,75 l bottle.
Poured murky brown with a small beige head that diminshes quickly. Aroma of cocoa and rosehip, marmalade, lurking hops. Flat flavor profile, some banana and cocoa. Expected more.

Bottle drank whilst shopping at Domus Birrae, 11/02/13.
Hazed dark amber with a medium sized beige head that retains well.
Nose is bannoffee pie, clove, spice, banana, classic dunkelweizen notes.
Taste comprises toffee, banana, spice, yeasts.
Medium body, light spritzy carbonation, some bitterness in the finish,
A solid dunkelweizen!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Pours hazy golden orange with a big off white head. Nose is tropical fruit, hay, caramel and molasses. The taste is sweet mostly, little bitter. The mouthfeel is soft and mellow, body is light and long finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Birra molto strana, leggero sentore di cioccolato come da etichetta, carbonatazione perfetta, come mi sta piacendo ultimamente, però il naso non è troppo evidente...Schiuma non densa, leggermente più amara delle weizen. In sostanza un buon esperimento, anche se fuori standard

Man nehme eine leicht bauchige Flasche, ein cooles Etikett, Imported & BraufactuM Aufkleber, verlange einen horrenden Preis und das Volk wirds schon kaufen und gutheißen nach dem Motto "Was relativ teuer ist, muss auch gut sein". Selten so gelacht. Wir haben hier ein stinknormales, dunkles Hefeweizen. Mittel- bis dunkelbraun, trüb und mit reichlich Schaum. Im Aroma hefig und etwas Banane. Trotz der immerhin 6% Alk. ist der Antrunk sehr dünn geraten. Der Geschmack ist hefig-weizig, leicht bananig und langweilig eintönig. Das Röstmalz sorgt dafür, dass dieses ital. Gebräu wenigstens angenehm nachbittert. Insgesamt ja nicht schlecht, aber kein Hype, sondern ein dunkles HW der Marke STANDARD.

0,75 l bottle.   BB 01. Jun 13. 
caramel, cereal, herbs, earthy, leaves, banana, brown, cloudy, rocky head, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,
Bottle @ birrificio italiano. It pours dark brown with a huge beige head on top. Malty and sweet but great balanced.

Pour is a dark brown with orangish edges and tight tan head.  The nose is very nice, strong yeast and fruit sweetness.  Peppery spice and twang up front, light dustiness transitions to banana and berries as a fruit balance is struck.  The taste is a hint short, yeast is more subtle and the spice is much less, fruits are less bright and more sugary with a dustier earthy presence mid palate.  Body is light and soft with a low carbonation and clean finish.
Amber-copper color with persistent and creamy foam. Intense fruit and malt aroma. Taste is so sweet with medium body and fruity.

Aroma di lievi note tostate a cui so aggiunge una gradevole acidità al gusto. Nel complesso discreta.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Unclear brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, caramel and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Sweet finish. Soft. 100412
Bottle, 6%. Hazy dark amber/brown with small tan head. Aroma is malt, wheat, fruit, caramel and yeast. Flavour is malt, medium sweet, caramel, wheat, yeast, dark fruits and a little bread.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy brown. Aroma and taste are yeast, dried fruits, wheat malt and hops. Medium carbonation.
Anchessa come la weizen tradizionale del birrificio italiano ha poco sentore di banana ed è a mio parere molto bevibile pur non rientrando nei miei canoni

750ml bottle. Cloudy brown with huge lasting off-white head. Fruit aroma, mainly banana, some yeast. Taste has sweetness and sourness of dark berries. Very good on the fruit side of Dunkelweizen, could have some more hay or herbal notes to be top of style.

750 ml bottle (6& ABV). A cloudy medium to dark brown beer, with a huge, frothy, rocky, lacing, almost fully lasting, beige head. The aroma is moderately malty (tosted bread/nuts, caramel, milk chocolate), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana and spices. The flavor is moderately sweet , lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, short finish with light to medium bitterness. Apart the thinness and the short aftertaste, it has a very enjoyable aroma and a big persistent head. Good stuff.

Bottle, bought @ CITTI, Flensborg.
Pours murky, dark chestnut with a firm, staying, creamy, off-white head. Aroma has good banana, light chocolate, some cocoa, light apple. Some mild chewing gum. Medium carbonation, dryish mouthfeel, nice light creaminess. Flavour is sweet caramel, clear wheat, good chocolate, some mild roasted malts, banana, cocoa. Some chestnuts and nutmeg and a bit of liqorice in the finish. A very lovely dunkelweizen.

Bottle @ De Molen 2nd tuesday tasting extravaganzza!

Older bottle. Aroma is caramel, raisins and spices.
Flavour is old malt, caramel and spice. Quite dry.
Weird style, dunkelweizen.
Portlike aroma. Hazy brown with vurtiually no head. Taste is port/wine, grapes, raisins. Low carbo, medium/thin body. Something between a beer and a portwine.

Bottle at the first monthly beer tasting @ De Molen hosted by dEnk. Clear reddish brown pour, quickly diminishing white head. Aroma is somewhat chemical, red wine, licorice, dark fruits. Flavor is quite dry, fruity, slightly spicy and a bit alcoholic and chemical. Strange brew, a bit old (2007), but still rather interesting.
Draught at BQ (Naviglio Grande), Milano. Color hazy amber with medium lasting white head. Aroma malt, wheat, yeast, citrus, banana. Taste sweet, wheat, citrus, acid, yeast.
Bottled. The aroma has some malty sweetness, raisin, hint of spice. Hazy, brown coloured beer with a thin, off-white head. The taste is sweet, caramel malty, has raisins and spice. Bit sticky.
Brown colored brew. Faint mslty aroma. Flavor has spices, banana, malts. Somewhat strange. Past its date.

Moderate beige head atop hazy red brown. Very sweet nose, bubblegum, ice cream, and a bit of salty, green plant elements, very contrasting. Flavor has tea and gum at the front with some burnt marshmallow mid palate and more caramel and sugar in the finish. Murky body, could use with some balancing bitterness and dryness.

Draught at BQ Piazza Arduino.
Hazy red brown coloured with a huge off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, chocolate and bananas.
Sweet and fruity flavor of caramel, bread and dark chocolate with notes of bananas.
Sweet finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2nd ES/CS Beer Tasting.  (thanks MM). Hazy ambery orange colour with a mediumsized off-white head. Aroma is wheat, fruits, slightly toasted notes along with some yeast and citrus. Flavour is much the same, but is a lot yeastier than the aroma.

Colore marrone scuro con una fine schiuma beige. Al naso leggero sentore di malto tostato e frutta. In bocca ancora tostato, con finale leggermente amaro ma poco acidulo. Essendo alla spina forse un pò watery, ma diversa dalle Dunkelweizen classiche.
Dark red slightly tan head. Melon, nutmeg, peach, cheese. Bit sweet. Slightly acidic taste with balanced sweetness. Interesting drink. (On tap at Bir&Fud)

draft @ Blue Monk, Buffalo. medium brown, very light aroma; absent of expect German wheat aroma of clove, banana, etc. Dunkel flavors come through meekly towards end of the flavor. Maltiness initially dominates up front then folllowed up by the light expected dunkel flavor. higher carbonation. ok
Alla spina a Rimini, Selezione Birra, sono sempre buone le birre del Birrificio Italiano, questa non la ricordavo di frumento, mi sembrava una dunkel normale

Im not a weizen lover anymore, but Ive tasted it one time. It left me a good sensation, manly the lightness. Dark-ambered color, persistent froth, average carbonation, bananas taste, fruity and well structured.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Hazy brown coloured brew with an German appearance and Belgian taste, quite sweet due the caramelmalts, and hints of banana. Italian special beers its an league of their own.

75 cL bottle, courtesy of cgarvieuk. Pours hazy brown with a small white head. Aroma is roasted malty and slight fruity, mild yeasty. Mild fruity and yeasty. Caramelish and overripe fruity. Mild hoppy.
bottle at home ... ligth hazy copper ... creamy bubbly head ... big yeasty toffee malt nose ... light fizz ... little banana ... little toffee malts  ... very drinkable ... creamy ...

draft @ redlight redlight.  Caramelized bananas with hints of milk chocolate on the nose.  Pours a murky amber brown with a solid white head.  Banana upfront with caramel malts and toasted wheat bread with clove in the finish.
Tap at Churchkey.  Cloudy brownish orange, no head or lacing.  Aroma of hay and straw.  Taste is malt and not much else.  Plain.

Brown murky beer with long lasting head. Sweet and malty smell, I do like that. But I dont like how this beer is behaving in my mouth, theres too much fizz. Taste is good, strong and lasts quite a while. I find chocolate,  earthy and alcohol aromas. Someone could say that Vudu is heavy beer, and it would not be over statement. There seems to be lost of big and small aromas in this one, no wonder others has liked this quite complex beer. Executive summary: pretty good.

Extra Note: If bottle size would be a bit smaller (75cl) I might buy this again some day, or at least consider sharing this beer with someone.

Bottle. Pours an unclear and brown beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, fruit, yeast and sweetness. The flavor follows the nose, but without the sweetness. The palate is sweet. Overall an average beer.
Pours cloudy copper with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, fruity notes, malty and notes of chewing gum. Flavour is malr, fruity, dry and light acidic.
Bottle. Thanks Scheffel. Pours muddy dark brown with a small creamy off white head. Nose is yeast, caramel and tart fruit. Spicy flavor with caramel, yeast, wheat , ginger and cinnamon. Medium bodied
bottle @ bir & fud shop: banana, yeast and nothing more. a very boring and light in flavour dunkelweizen

Bottle @ bir&fud bottega, Rome.
Strong of sweet bananas aroma you could smell from a distance. Medium-highly carbonated, medium body. Very drinkable, despite an ending that turns off too fast.

750 ml bottle, courtesy of Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 6%. Dark brown colour, hazy. Moderate off-white head. Flowers and ripe berries in the aroma, hints of cloves too. Fruity and fairly sweet flavour, notes of bananas and cloves. Very moderate hops. Nice beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Banana and toffee aroma. Cloudy, brown colour, beige head, good lace. Sweet, nice bitterness, banana, toffee, light yeasty. Soft and full. Flavourful, easy going, balanced. I like this style when brewed well and this one certainly is.

Molto torrefatta, una dunkelweizen un poco più dunkel che weizen ma comunque eccezionalmente beverina; direi la birra da autunno, quando scende qualche grado di temperatura e si comincia a odorare la stufa dei più anziani.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2010 scura buona schiuma persistente insolito anche il bicchiere in cui viene servita profumi freschi aciduli malto banana fruttato cioccolato il tostato si avverte poco acidulo dello stile e in evidenza e molto piacevole poca frizzantezza

On draught at the brewpub. 
Hazy brown colour with medium-sized head, not as steady as the style suggests. Very creamy mouthfeel with big malt profile and lots of sweetness. No toast here. Slight alcoholic in finish. Lacking in esters and phenols. Unbalanced for the style.

Draught @ Brewery tap, Birrificio Italiano, Lurago Marinone (CO), Italy. Light hazy medium amber / orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, moderate to heavy yeasty, citrus acidic, banana. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light light acidic with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. (081107)

Medium yellowish beige lasting head. Brownish black hazy opaque body. Sugary bubble gum aroma with wooden spicy notes. Taste has banana, fruit, and wheaty notes, and is vaguely roasty. Very watery, much too watery for me. Did not enjoy this. (0.5l draft at Isola della Birra.)

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2007 Nice dunkelweizen, on tap in characteristic glasses (several) at Birrificio Italiano. High drinkability for a medium bodied, full hazy brown bier. Good head. Fruity, with malty notes.Not much DW for me so far, but that was a very pleasant experience.

Draught  Huge yellowish head; fully hazy brown beer, greenish nose. Cloves, wry banana, mossy, earthy notes. Sweet - very sweet for a Dunkel Weizen, and an ending with chocolate, but further pretty short of taste. Medium bodied; aftertaste is pure wryness. Finish and sweet beginning do not flow in each other, they clash. Not very likeable, strange Dunkelweizen, like a mole-coloured Hefe, wry.

On tap, at Artebirra 2003, Italian Craft Beer festival in Milan.
Cloudy brown colour, light brownish, persitant head.
Aroma is fruity (banana) & spicy, aroma of toasted malt, fresh yeast. Flavor is balanced between dark toasted malt and ripe fruits (banana, raisin, apple) with a very low bitterness and dry finish. 
Pleasant!

As I already told to my mate fiulijn, the taste was disgusting, remembering the dentist studio... :-)
Back soon to my Guinness :-P

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2008 2007-12-29, draught at the brewpub, 7-5-6-3-13=34Muddy brown color; generous creamy head; its served in its original glass, short and very large, very beautiful. Sweet aroma of Weizen, with nice banana touch.  The body is medium-thin; there is a quite good malty flavor (for a Weizen), with some banana and light spices, some fudge too; sweetish; unfortunately it gets thinner and weaker at the end. Refreshing, but not impressive.2002-09-24, draught at the brewpub, 8-5-7-4-14=38, 6% ABVCloudy brown colour, persistent collar of foam. Intense aroma (Im sorry, but I was so tired, I could not spot it exactely; my mate didnt appreciate and said it smelt like a medicine). Smooth, some sweetness, some fruitness (cassis again?), malt, roasted malt. Enough bitterTheres something unusual that I couldnt determine. Anyway, it has a strong character, its pretty good, a strange (original) evolution of a Mild.
